sen.j: 尾張 馬身（おわり の まみ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OWARI no Mami was active in the Asuka period of Japan (year of birth and death unknown).
OWARI no Mami was a figure in the Asuka period of Japan (year of birth and death unknown).
sen.cmt: activeをa figureに変更しました。
sen.e: OWARI no Mami was a figure in the Asuka period of Japan (year of birth and death unknown).

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「をはりのまみ」。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name had been written as Wohari no Mami, and it is considered to have been pronounced Wofari no Mami.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥時代は、は行をFで、わ行をWで発音していたので、Wofariとなります。
sen.e: In old Japanese orthography, his name had been written as Wohari no Mami, and it is considered to have been pronounced Wofari no Mami.
sen.cmt: 「旧仮名遣い」をデータベースに合わせ、old Japanese orthographyとしました。
sen.e: In old Japanese orthography, his name had been written as Wohari no Mami, and it is considered to have been pronounced Wofari no Mami.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき、大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側に立って戦った。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War of 672, he fought supporting Oama no Miko (Oshiama no Miko or Prince Oama who became Emperor Tenmu following the victory in the war).
In the Jinshin War of 672, he fought supporting Oama no Miko (Oshiama no Miko or Prince Oama who became Emperor Tenmu following the victory in the war).
In the Jinshin War of 672, he fought supporting Oama no Miko (Oshiama no Miko or Prince Oama who became Emperor Tenmu following the victory in the war).
His last rank was Shokinge (fifth rank, lower grade).

His last rank was Shokinge (fifth rank, lower grade).

sen.j: 壬申の乱について記す『日本書紀』に尾張馬身の名は見えず、『続日本紀』天平宝字2年（758年）4月19日の記事でのみ知られる。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan) didn't record about Mami's achievement in the Jinshin War; however, based on the article of April 19, 758 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), it is known that he fought in the war.
OWARI no Mami appears not in the article about the Jinshin War of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan) but in that about June 3, 758 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更し、全体を簡略化しました。
sen.e: OWARI no Mami appears not in the article about the Jinshin War of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan) but in that about June 3, 758 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).

sen.j: そこには、「はじめ尾張連馬身は壬申の年の功で小錦下になったが、まだ姓を賜わらないうちにその身が早く亡くなった。
sen.e: According to it, Mami was raised to Shokinge for the achievement in the Jinshin War, and before he was given a new kabane, he died.
According to it, Mami was raised to Shokinge for the achievement in the Jinshin War and died before being given a new kabane.
sen.cmt: 後半を言い換えました。
sen.e: According to it, Mami was raised to Shokinge for the achievement in the Jinshin War and died before being given a new kabane.

sen.j: これによって、馬身の子孫に等しく宿禰の姓を賜う」とある。
sen.e: Therefore, instead of Mami, his descendants was equally given a kabane, Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
Therefore, instead of Mami, his descendants were equally given a kabane, Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
Therefore, instead of Mami, his descendants were equally given a kabane, Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: だが『日本書紀』には、天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日に50氏に宿禰の姓を与えたという記事があり、その中に尾張連も入っている。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", on December 2, 684, fifty clans were given Sukune, and one of them was Owari no Muraji.
According to "Nihonshoki," however, on January 15, 685, fifty clans were given Sukune and Owari no Muraji was one of them.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更し、howeverを補足しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," however, on January 15, 685, fifty clans were given Sukune and Owari no Muraji was one of them.

sen.j: これは尾張連でも尾張大隅の一族に対するもので、馬身の一族は別だったのであろう。
sen.e: Presumably, this Owari no Muraji was the Owari clan of Osumi Province, and Mami was from other Owari clan.
Presumably, this Owari no Muraji was the Owari clan of Osumi Province, and Mami was from other Owari clan.

sen.j: また、馬身の死がこれより以前であったことも推測できる。
sen.e: And based on this artcle of "Nihonshoki", Mami is considered to have died at the latest before December 2, 684.
And based on this article of "Nihonshoki," Mami is considered to have died before this date at the latest.
